name: Military Wife
description: A mug I acquired during one of my first trips to the thriftstores of Bellingham, among a few other items mentioned elsewhere.

images.alt: Text on the mug reads 'Military Wife' in thin lettering.'
Bottom of the mug shows Rae Dunn as the maker.'

name: Millk Mug
description: Bought at the Las Vegas Omega Mart at Meow Wolf. Bizarre grocery store shopping experience that is more than it seems.

images.alt: Milk carton shaped mug. A cow is repeated over and over stamped across the front. Advertises as enriched with 'vitamin dram'
Angled shot of side showing 'Obligatory Facts' instead of Nutritional Facts
Close-up of 'Obligatory Facts'.
Close-up of Ingredients.
Downward shot of mug with its carton lid off.

name: Sharp Gentleman
description: The bright pink color of the tray caught my eye, and the look of the man printed on was enough for me to buy it. I aspire to have more dishes with people on them.

images.alt: A pink rectangular tray has a man dressed in a suit with round glasses and combed hair printed on it in pop art style.
Bottom of the tray shows supposedly Fabienne Jouvin as the maker, which would be quite the find if true.

name: Three Pure Ones
description: Bought during the same trip as the pop art style tray, I was looking through the mugs. The three men on the mug reminded me of The Three Pure Ones, who are the highest gods in Taoist myth, so I bought it.

images.alt: A man in green robes and a beard with two women by his side drinking something.
A man in red robes and a beard with two women by his side drinking something.
A man in pink robes and a beard with two women by his side drinking something. The rim of the mug is chipped.
Bottom of the mug shows Konitz as the maker.

name: Bible Bowl
description: During my most recent trip to Good Will I bought this and a mug, along with some other kitchen items. It has the bible verse Romans 8:28 on it

images.alt: Wrapped around a wide bowl is the first part of the bible verse Romans 8:28.
Second half of Romans 8:28.
Bottom of the bowl shows Coventry as the maker.

name: Wet Paint
description: This was the mug I bought along with the Bible Bowl during my most recent trip. It was mislabled inside another box so it was not exactly what I expected, but I like it anyways.

images.alt: A clown in shabby clothes and a bucket hat stands under a ladder by a wet paint sign as rain drops on him.
Bottom of the mug shows it was made in Japan.

name: Bible Mug
description: What ties it together beyond the bible quote is the default font for the '1 Corinthians 13' part. It's the cherry on top.

images.alt: Around the mug is a floral pattern. Theres also the bible verse Corinthians 13.
Bottom of the mug shows Bay Island as the maker.
